abstract: In the most recent sign that Apple is looking at alternative ways for people to store and play digital music, the company is said to be finalizing talks to acquire Lala, a three-year-old start-up.
snippet: In the most recent sign that Apple is looking at alternative ways for people to store and play digital music, the company is said to be finalizing talks to acquire Lala, a three-year-old start-up.
lead_paragraph: In the most recent sign that Apple is looking at alternative ways for people to store and play their digital music, the company is finalizing talks to acquire Lala, a three-year-old start-up based in Palo Alto, Calif., two people with knowledge of the discussions said Friday, The New York Times’s Brad Stone reports from San Francisco.

headline.main: Apple Is Said to Be Close to Buying Music Start-Up
